## Code Review Checklist (Reviewer)

### Reviewer Prerequisites
- [ ] I am not an involved developer (have not committed code to this PR)
- [ ] I have sufficient language and area knowledge to review effectively
- [ ] I have added myself to the Reviewers section

### Code Quality
- [ ] **No obvious bugs** - Variable names, argument order, and logic appear correct
- [ ] **Security considerations** - No apparent security vulnerabilities or concerns
- [ ] **DRY principle** - No unnecessary duplicate code identified
- [ ] **Code style** - Consistent formatting, logical indentation, and clear conditional usage
- [ ] **Naming conventions** - Functions, variables, and artifacts are clearly named
- [ ] **Comments & documentation** - Complex code has adequate explanatory comments

### Testing
- [ ] **Tests present** - Appropriate tests exist for new/modified functionality
- [ ] **Tests passing** - All unit tests and security scans pass
- [ ] **Test coverage** - Test coverage is adequate for the changes

### Improvements
- [ ] **Performance** - No obvious performance issues
- [ ] **Error handling** - Appropriate exception handling is in place
- [ ] **Logging** - Adequate logging for debugging and monitoring
- [ ] **Code efficiency** - Code is idiomatic and not overly complex or verbose

### Merge Readiness
- [ ] All automated checks pass
- [ ] Changes have been tested/validated
- [ ] Documentation is updated if needed
- [ ] Story/subtask status will be updated after merge (e.g., to Issue Review)
